name: Medical Symptom Triage Agent
description: AI-powered medical triage agent that conducts intelligent symptom assessment, generates dynamic follow-up questions using advanced language models, and provides urgency recommendations with appropriate medical referrals. Compliant with A2A protocol for seamless agent-to-agent communication.

extensions.description: AI-powered dynamic question generation for medical triage
Real-time emergency condition detection and 911 recommendations

apiKey.name: X-API-Key
apiKey.description: API key for accessing medical triage services

skills.name: Medical Symptom Triage
skills.description: Conducts comprehensive medical symptom assessment using AI-generated dynamic questions. Evaluates urgency levels (emergency, urgent, routine) and provides appropriate medical care recommendations with specialist referrals.
examples: I have a severe headache that started this morning and is getting worse
I'm experiencing chest pain and shortness of breath after climbing stairs
My child has a fever of 102Â°F and isn't eating or drinking
I have abdominal pain that's sharp and located in my lower right side
I fell and hit my head, now I feel dizzy and nauseous
I have been coughing up blood for the past hour

skills.name: Emergency Condition Assessment
skills.description: Rapid assessment for potentially life-threatening conditions with immediate 911 recommendations when appropriate. Uses advanced pattern recognition to identify emergency symptoms requiring immediate medical attention.
examples: I'm having severe chest pain with sweating and pain radiating to my arm
I can't breathe properly and my lips are turning blue
I have severe bleeding from a wound that won't stop
I'm experiencing sudden severe headache unlike any I've had before
I think I'm having a stroke - my face feels numb and I can't speak clearly

skills.name: Pediatric Symptom Assessment
skills.description: Specialized triage assessment for children and infants with age-appropriate questioning and urgency evaluation. Includes fever protocols, developmental considerations, and parent/caregiver guidance.
examples: My 6-month-old baby has a fever and seems very lethargic
My 4-year-old fell from the playground and is crying but conscious
My toddler has been vomiting and has diarrhea for 6 hours
My newborn hasn't been eating well and seems to have trouble breathing

skills.name: Chronic Condition Assessment
skills.description: Assessment and monitoring for patients with existing chronic conditions (diabetes, hypertension, heart disease, etc.) to determine if current symptoms require immediate attention or routine follow-up.
examples: I have diabetes and my blood sugar has been running high with nausea
I have heart disease and I'm experiencing unusual fatigue and swelling
I have asthma and my inhaler isn't helping with my breathing today

skills.name: Medication and Symptom Interaction Assessment
skills.description: Evaluates if current symptoms might be related to medications, drug interactions, or side effects. Provides guidance on whether symptoms warrant immediate medical attention or medication adjustment.
examples: I started a new medication yesterday and now I have a rash
I'm taking multiple medications and feeling very dizzy and confused
I think my blood pressure medication might be causing these symptoms
